alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 6:56PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Anderson, south central Pickens and southeastern Oconee Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 656 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Clemson, or near Pendleton. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clemson, Central, Pendleton, Lake Hartwell and Sandy Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
